basics.name: David PIATEK
basics.label: Lead Developer - DevOps - Backend Developer
basics.summary:
Father of two, living in the countryside, I have built a personal and professional balance that helps me navigate the pressure and intense pace of tech with calm and clarity.

A technology enthusiast from the start, I built my career around software development before moving into Tech Lead responsibilities. This experience led me to work on architecture, software quality and infrastructure, and to gradually shift towards DevOps.

Today, I operate with a full-product vision, combining development, DevOps and automation ‚Äî in a context where AI is accelerating cycles and reinforcing the value of profiles capable of building and industrialising end-to-end solutions.

work.summary: Freelance missions around process automation and showcase website development.
As a freelance developer, my mission was to take ownership of the legacy codebase and deploy it on Azure.
As Tech Lead, I managed my squad. In collaboration with the Product Owner and Test Manager, we defined specifications and I ensured technical feasibility.

My initial mission was to maintain the existing version while adding new features. I then handled recruitment for the new team ahead of a full rewrite, during which I set up the infrastructure and architecture.
highlights: Rebuilt the stack after OVH datacenter fire

work.summary: Defined product direction and implemented the architecture and DevOps for building an ERP/CRM platform targeting small businesses.

Delivered PrestaShop as SaaS by locking down features for security and performance. Migrated customers to their own servers when the SaaS offer ended. Contributed to the new PrestaShop monetisation system.
highlights: Flexible migration script for any hosting provider

work.summary: Within a early-stage startup, I built the team while ensuring knowledge transfer from service providers. Working with product and infrastructure teams, we devised out-of-the-box solutions to enable communication between the website and notary software.
As a fullstack developer, I worked across multiple PHP technologies (Joomla, Symfony) and built REST and SOAP web services.
Business management, photography, and photo development.

volunteer.summary: Organising a music festival for 10 years to bring life to the village.
Parents' association working to keep the village and its small community school alive.

references.name: Guillaume Beauventre - CTO - OneyTrust
references.reference:
I had the pleasure of managing David as a freelance developer & DevOps and I highly recommend him.
David has an excellent command of DevOps practices. He played a key role in improving our CI/CD and greatly helped us with our cloudification and Kubernetes migration project. His strong technical skills enabled us to effectively modernise our infrastructure.
On a personal level, David stands out for his patience and ability to clearly explain complex technical concepts. His smooth communication and calm temperament make him a team favourite. He knows how to build consensus and facilitates collective decision-making.

references.name: Paul Jay - CTO - Skaleet
references.reference:
David's software development expertise is undeniable: deep knowledge of PHP, and above all of software craftsmanship practices. On top of that, he has solid knowledge of infrastructure tooling: CI/CD, Docker, Kubernetes...

David is also a very pleasant person, committed to his work and appreciated by his colleagues.
He doesn't get stuck on problems ‚Äî he seeks and finds solutions.

I loved having him on my team.

references.name: Dominique Bazin - Head of Innovation - Foxnot
references.reference: One of a kind! David is an absolute standout at work ‚Äî it's impressive!! On a human level, he is an exceptionally gifted manager! A true pleasure to grow a solution and a company alongside him!
